public abstract class zeta.session.Locator

(source file: Locator.pizza)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.util.Term
           |
           +----zeta.session.Locator
The pure class interface. 
public abstract class Locator
  extends Term
The abstract class and annotation slot of locators.

An locator describes the location of a source in a tool connected to the session system.

Every locator has associated the name of the tool adaptor where it originates from, and can be formatted for visualisation. The creation of locators is done inside of tool adaptors.

Locators can be combined building new locators. Such a combined locator consists of a primary locator (which determines the tool adaptor the combined locator belongs to) and a secondary locator. Combined locators are used to address situations where objects have been derived from several sources.

This class also provides an annotation slot for locators to be annotated at terms.

Version: $Id: Locator.pizza,v 1.5 2000/06/20 07:00:25 wg Exp $

Locator
public Locator();

slot
public static final Slot slot;
The slot object.

getTool
public abstract Name getTool();
Return the name of the tool adaptor this locator belongs to.

toFormat

public abstract Format toFormat(FormatInfo info);
Convert this locator to a format.

Overrides:
toFormat in class Term

getMnemonic

public String getMnemonic();
Return a short string describing this locator. The string should narrow the complete information as obtained by toFormat(). By default, this returns the content of toFormat().

compareTo

public int compareTo(Locator loc);
Lexicographical ordering of locators. By default, uses the string representation obtained by toFormat.

combine

public Locator combine(Locator other);
Combine this locator with other locator. By default, this locator becomes the primary locator of the combined locator, the other locator becomes secondary. Subclasses may overwrite this method with a refined meaning -- for example, text locators which overlapp in the same file can be merged into a single locator.

extend

public Locator extend(Locator other);
Build a locator "containing" this and the other locator. For example, for metric locators which address text regions in the same file, this method constructs a locator which covers both text regions. By default, this method behaves like combining locators.

See also:
combine

getPrimary

public Locator getPrimary();
Get the primary locator of this locator. If this is not a combined locator, then the primary locator is this locator itself.

getSecondary

public Locator getSecondary();
Get the secondary locator of this locator. If this is not a combined locator, then the secondary locator is null.

getVisitCapabilities

public VisitCapability[] getVisitCapabilities();
Get the visiting capabilites of this locator. This is an array since a locator may have different of them. By default, this returns an empty array.

nativeVisit

public void nativeVisit();
Native visit of the source this locator points to. By default, throws an error.

put

public static void put(Annotation an,
                       Locator locator);
Set value of locator annotation slot.

Parameters:
an - the annotation
locator - the locator

get

public static Locator get(Annotation an);
Get value of locator annotation slot.

Parameters:
an - the annotation
Returns:
the locator, or null, if no one is provided.

isProvided

public static boolean isProvided(Annotation an);
Test whether locator annotation slot is provided.

Parameters:
an - the annotation
Returns:
true if the locator annotation slot is provided
